member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Data.Field.Formula
member.summary:
Field Value, used for unbound fields, this can be a formula or a static value Formaula can be combination of any number of other bound or unbound fields. eg. 1. Field3.Formula = field1 + field2; (where field1 = Field1.Name and field2 = Field2.Name) 2. field1.Formula = "\"Hello : \" + CustomerID"; 3. field1.Formula = "2 + 4 / 6"
Value of Field is based on FieldType which is used to evaluate as the type and the result is set to Field.Value Order of Evaluation: 1. Field.Formula, 2. If Field.Formula is null, Field.DefaultValue is used. 3. If Field.DefaultValue is null, Field.Value is used, which may or may not be null. Field.Value can also be set at run time.

member.name: T:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration
member.summary: CSSDeclaration represents the declaration block of a CSS rule. Provides a programmatic interface directly to the CSS declarations.
member.remarks: Use the publicly accessable m_pXxxx structs to retrieve known property values. Unknown properties and their text values are available in the publicly accessable m_unknownPropTable variable. Use AppendValue to append values to this CSSDeclaration.

member.name: F:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.m_pFont
member.summary: Gets any font property declarations in this CSSDeclaration.

member.name: F:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.m_pColor
member.summary: Gets any color related declarations in this CSSDeclaration.

member.name: F:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.m_pText
member.summary: Gets any text related declarations (spacing, decoration, alignment) in this CSSDeclaration.

member.name: F:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.m_pMargin
member.summary: Gets any text margin declarations in this CSSDeclaration.

member.name: F:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.m_pPosition
member.summary: Gets any text positional declarations (spacing, decoration, alignment) in this CSSDeclaration.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.Reset
member.summary: Resets all CSSValues contained in this declaration.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.AppendValue(DDCssLib.eCSSProperty,DDCssLib.CSSValue)
member.summary: Adds the specified value for the specified property to this CSSDeclaration.
member.param: The property the value should be used for.
The value of the property.
member.remarks: This method will keep track of the order that the properties are added in so that when the CSS string is recreated, you have the capability to list the properties in the same order as they were originally specified in the declaration block.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.AppendUnknownValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Used to append unknown properties to this declaration. The unknown name and value will be used only when rebuilding the CSS string again.
member.param: The unchanged name of the CSS property parsed.
The unchanged value for the CSS property.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetValue(DDCssLib.eCSSProperty)
member.summary: Returns the value of the specified property as a CSSValue object.
member.param: The property to get the value of.
member.returns: The CSSValue object containing the specified property's value.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetValue(DDCssLib.eCSSProperty,System.String@)
member.summary: Retrieves the value for the specified CSS property from this declaration instance and places the value into sValue.
member.param: The CSS property to retrieve the value for.
The string variable to set to the string representation of the specified property's value.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetImportantValues(DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration@)
member.summary: Returns all of the property/values in this CSSDeclaration instance that were marked with the !important declaration.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetValueIsImportant(DDCssLib.eCSSProperty,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines if the specified property stored in this CSSDeclaration instance was marked with the !important declaration.
member.param: The property to check for important.
The boolean variable who's value will be True if the specified property is marked as important, or false if the specified property is not marked as important.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetValueIsImportant(System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines if the specified property stored in this CSSDeclaration instance was marked with the !important declaration.
member.param: The string name of the property to check for important.
The boolean variable who's value will be True if the specified property is marked as important, or false if the specified property is not marked as important.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of declarations stored by this CSSDeclaration instance (that were added with AppendValue).

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetProperty(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the eCSSProperty at the specified index in the property order array.
member.param: The index within the order array to retrieve the element at.
member.returns: The eCSSProperty value at the specified index within the order array.
member.remarks: The "order array" keeps track of what order the properties were added to the declaration in, so that when the CSS string is recreated the properties are in the original order.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.ToString
member.summary: Returns the propery/value pair(s) contained in this CSSDeclaration in standards based CSS declaration block syntax.
member.returns: The CSS text string. If there are not any properties stored by this CSSDeclaration, an empty string will be returned.

member.summary: Creates copy of this instance and places it in the specified variable.
member.param: The variable to contain a copy of the instance of CSSDeclaration the Clone method is called on.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetAutoValue
member.summary: Specifies that this CSSValue's value is the CSS keyword 'auto'.
member.remarks: Used for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, margin-left, margin, width, and height values.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetInheritValue
member.summary: Indicates that this value is not null, not none, but should be inherited from the parent object of the object who's style this value is applied to. In CSS this is the default value for many *child* elements's (but certainly not all) style properties who's style is not specified.
member.remarks: See CSS Level 1 Recomendation Section 1.3 Inheritance: http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-CSS1#inheritance An important statement in this section is the following: "Some style properties are not inherited from the parent element to the child element. Most often it is intuitive why this is not the case. E.g., the 'background' property does not inherit, but the parent element's background will shine through by default."

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetNoneValue
member.summary: Sets this class's value to the special CSS value 'none' (e.g. border properties, background-image, display, etc...).

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetNormalValue
member.summary: Sets this class'es value to the special CSS value 'normal'. (e.g. font-style, font-variant, font-weight, word-spacing, letter-spacing, line-height).

member.summary: Gets/sets the FontFamily value. If this StyleSheetRule's declaration does not contain the value, or the value is indicated as null, it will be returned from it's parent. member.remarks: Multiple families seperated by commas may be returned.

member.name: P:DDCssLib.StyleSheetRule.DdCharset
member.summary: Implementation of IStyleSheetRule.DdCharset. DdCharset is the charset/script for the font.

members.member:
Returns font size in points.
Sometimes font-size is specified (in the CSS style string) in a value that cannot be converted to points. For example a size relative to the parent, and there is no parent. Or Font XHeight (the height of the letter x) where this not enough data to perform a conversion. // the reason other props don't through exceptions is because we return Inherit in the event of an error on the get. This can't be done with FontSize because it's not an enum.

Derived classes override this method to implement custom Dispose logic and call on this implementation.

member.summary: Specifies a true or false value.

member.summary: Specifies an ISO 8601 date/time value.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Expressions.ExpressionObjectModel.ParameterType.Integer
member.summary: Specifies an integral number.
member.remarks: For a calendar date format the date string as follows: YYYY-MM-DD For example 2003-04-01 represents the first day of April in 2003. For a date and time, format the string as follows: YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss Note that the T serves a seperator between the date and time. For example 2003-04-01T13:01:02 represents one minute and two seconds after one o'clock in the afternoon of 2003-04-01. Without any further additions, a date and time is assumed to be in a local time zone. To indicate the time is measured in UTC, you can append a capital letter Z to the end of the time string.

member.summary: Specifies a floating point number.

Specifies whether parameter should not be displayed to the user.
Specifies whether the new parameter accepts multiple values.
Specifies whether the new parameter is used in a query.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.DataRegion
member.summary: Specifies a region where a dataset is laid out for a report. A data region bound to a dataset's results may repeat its contents to account for the dataset's size. The List, Matrix, Table and Chart report items are all data regions.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ReportItem
member.summary: A report item is one of the following types of objects: Line, Rectangle, TextBox, Image, Subreport, CustomReportItem, or DataRegion. DataRegions include List, Table, Matrix, and Chart. The ReportItem element itself is not used. Instead, the specific report item element is used whenever ReportItem is allowed.

remarks.para: The properties in this base class are shared among all types of ReportItem elements. Note, however, that not all properties of the ReportItem are necessarily meaningful for all types of report items.

member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the report item.

value.para: A String indicating the name of the report item.

summary.para: Gets or sets the the style settings for the report item.

value.para: A Style object representing the style elements of the report item.

summary.para: Gets or sets an action (e.g. hyperlink) to perform when the report item is clicked.

value.para: An Action object representing the action to perform when the report item is clicked.

summary.para: Gets or sets the distance of the item from the top of the containing object.

value.para: A Length structure indicating the distance of the item from the top of the containing object.

remarks.para: The default value is 0 if no value is provided.

summary.para: Gets or sets the distance of the item from the left edge of the containing object.

value.para: A Length structure indicating the distance of the item from the left edge of the containing object.

remarks.para: The default value is 0 if no value is provided.

summary.para: Gets or sets the height of the report item.

value.para: A Length structure indicating the report item's height.

remarks.para: Negative sizes are allowed only for the Line report item.
The default value is the height of the containing object minus the , if no value is provided.
For Table and Matrix report items, the default values for Height and Width are instead derived from the sizes of the component parts (columns, rows, matrix cells).

summary.para: Gets or sets the width of the report item.

value.para: A Length structure indicating the width of the report item.

remarks.para: Negative sizes are allowed only for Line report items.
The default value is the width of the containing object minus the , if no value is provided.
For Table and Matrix report items, the default values for Height and Width are instead derived from the sizes of the component parts (columns, rows, matrix cells).

summary.para: Gets or sets the drawing order of the report item within the containing object.

value.para: An Integer indicating the drawing order of the report item within the containing object.

remarks.para: Items with lower indices are drawn first (appearing behind items with higher indices).
Items with equal indices have an unspecified order.
The default value is 0. The minimum value is 0. The maximum value is 21474836478.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the items are hidden.

value.para: A Visibility object indicating whether the report item is hidden.

summary.para: Gets or sets a textual label for the report item.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a textual label for the report item.

remarks.para: The ToolTip is used for such things as including TITLE and ALT attributes in HTML reports.

summary.para: Gets or sets a label to identify an instance of a report item within the client UI (to provide a user-friendly label for searching or to appear in the Document Map).

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object containing a label to identify an instance of a report item within the client UI.

remarks.para: Hierarchical listings of report items and group labels within the UI (the Document Map) reflect the object containment hierarchy in the report definition. Peer items are listed in left-to-right, top-to-bottom order.
If the expression returns null, no item is addded to the Document Map.
Labels are not used for report items in the page header or footer.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the report item contained directly within the report item that is the target location for the Document Map label (if any).

value.para: A String indicating the name of the report item contained directly within the report item that is the target location for the Document Map label.

remarks.para: Used only for Rectangle report items.
This property is ignored if a is not present.

summary.para: Gets or sets a bookmark that can be linked via a Bookmark action.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a bookmark that can be linked via a bookmark action.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the DataRegion with which the report item is repeated if that data region spans multiple pages.

value.para: A String indicating the name of the DataRegion with which the report item is repeated if that data region spans multiple pages.

remarks.para: The DataRegion must be in the same ReportItemsCollection as the ReportItem.
Since a DataRegion is not allowed in a page header or footer, RepeatWith is not usable inside a page header or footer.
Repetition is not allowed if the report item is a DataRegion, a Subreport, or a Rectangle that contains a DataRegion or Subreport.

summary.para: Gets or sets custom information to be passed to a report output component.

value.para: A Custom object containing custom information to be passed to a report output component.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name to use for the data element or attribute for the report item.

value.para: A String indicating the name to use for the data element or attribute for the report item.

remarks.para: The default value is the of the report item

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item appears in a data rendering.

value.para: A DataElementOutput enumeration indicating whether the item appears in a data rendering.

remarks.para: Output indicates that the group appears in the output.
NoOutput indicates that the group does not appear in the output.
ContentsOnly indicates that the item does not appear in the XML, but its contents are rendered as if they were in the item's container. This value only applies to Lists.
Auto(Default) behaves in the same manner as NoOutput for Textbox report items with constant values, ContentsOnly for Rectangle report items and Output for all other items.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.DataRegion.KeepTogether

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a data region is kept together on a single page where possible.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the data region's content is kept together on a single page if possible; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.remarks: If the data region is larger than the body of the page, the property is ignored.

summary.para: Gets or sets the message to display inside the data region when the region contains no rows.

value.para: A String value containing the message to display inside the data region instead of the layout content when the region contains no rows.

remarks.para: If the NoRows message is displayed, the style information for the region is applied to the text.

Data regions inside a Table or Matrix cell that do not have a NoRows property value set display no content when there is no data, but the region's border and background properties are still applied to the cell.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the dataset that the data region uses.

value.para: A String containing the name of the dataset that the data region uses to lay out its content.

remarks.para: If there are multiple datasets in the report, the DataSetName is required for all DataRegions not contained inside a parent data region. If there is only one dataset in the report, this dataset will be assumed if the DataSetName is not specified. If there are no datasets in the report, the DataSetName cannot be set.
This property is ignored in child data regions.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.DataRegion.PageBreakAtStart

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a page break occurs immediately before the data region begins.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that a page break occurs immediately before the data region begins; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.remarks: If a data region has PageBreakAtStart set to true, any controls laid out above the data region that extend past the beginning of the data region horizontally are not moved to the next page.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.DataRegion.PageBreakAtEnd

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a page break occurs immediately after the data region ends.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that a page break occurs immediately after the data region ends; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.remarks: If a data region has PageBreakAtEnd set to true, any controls laid out horizontally before the data region ends that extend past the end of the data region are moved to the next page.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a data region is in it's own section

value.para: A Boolean value indicating whether a data region is in it's own section. Default value is false.

summary.para: Represents the data region's maximum width per page.

value.para: Represents the data region's maximum width per page. If undefined use ReportItem.Width.

summary.para: Represents the data region's maximum height per page.

value.para: Represents the data region's maximum height per page. If undefined use ReportItem.Height.

summary.para: Represents the data region's overflow name.

value.para: Represents the data region's overflow name.

summary.para: Gets the collection of filters applied to each row of data within the data region.

value.para: A FilterCollection object containing the filters applied to each row of data within the data region.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Chart
member.summary: The Chart element defines a chart data region. The Chart is defined much like a Matrix, but instead of Columns, Rows, and Cells, the Chart has Categories, Series, and DataPoints.
member.remarks: A Chart must have either a defined SeriesGroupings or a defined CategoryGroupings property, or both.

member.summary: Gets the expressions required for chart to be rendered.

member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets the type of the chart.

value.para: A ChartType enumeration indicating the type of chart.

summary.para: Gets or sets the subtype of the chart.
summary.remarks: Available subtypes, and their default values, depend on the chart's Type.

value.para: A ChartSubtype enumeration indicating the subtype of the chart.

item.description: Plain (Default), Stacked, and PercentStacked
Plain (Default), Stacked, and PercentStacked
Plain (Default) and Smooth
Plain (Default) and Exploded
Plain (Default), Line, and SmoothLine
Plain (Default)
Plain (Default), PercentStacked, and Stacked
Plain (Default) and Exploded
HighLowClose (Default), OpenHighLowClose, and Candlestick

summary.para: Gets the set of series groupings for the chart.

summary.para: Gets the set of category groupings for the chart.

value.para: A CategoryGroupingCollection indicating the set of category groupings for the chart.

summary.para: Gets the data values for the chart.

value.para: A ChartSeriesCollection indicating the data values for the chart.

summary.para: Gets or sets the chart legend.

value.para: A Legend object representing the chart's legend.

summary.para: Gets or sets the category axis.

value.para: A ValueCategoryAxis representing the chart's category axis.

summary.para: Gets or sets the value axis.

value.para: A ValueCategoryAxis representing the chart's value axis.

summary.para: Gets or sets the title for the chart.

value.para: A Title object representing the chart's title.

summary.para: Gets or sets the percent width for bars and columns. A value of 100 represents 100% of the distance between points. A value greater than 100 causes columns to overlap.

value.para: A NullableInt32 representing the percent width for bars and columns.

summary.para: Gets or sets the color palette for the chart items.

value.para: A ChartPalette enumeration indicating the color palette for the chart items.

summary.para: Gets or sets the properties for a 3D chart layout.

value.para: A ThreeDProperties object representing the properties for a 3D layout.

summary.para: Gets or sets the properties for the plot area.

value.para: A PlotArea object representing the properties for a plot area.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a DataPoint element containing the chart data points appears in a data rendering.

value.para: A DataElementOutput enumeration indicating whether a DataPoint element containing the chart data points appears in a data rendering. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: The chart appears in an XML rendering of the report.
The chart appears in an XML rendering of the report.
The chart does not appear in an XML rendering of the report.
This value does not apply to the chart data region.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Axis
member.summary: The Axis element defines properties for labels, titles and gridlines along an axis.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Axis.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis labels are displayed.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the axis labels are displayed; otherwise false. The default value is false.

summary.para: Gets or sets text style properties for the axis labels and line style properties for the axis line.

value.para: A Style object indicating the text style properties for the axis labels and line style properties for the axis line.

summary.para: Gets or sets the title for the axis.

value.para: A Title object indicating the title to display for the axis.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether an axis margin is created. The size of the margin is automatically generated based on the scale and the number of data points.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the axis margin is created; otherwise false. The default value is false.

summary.para: Gets or sets the style of the major tick marks.

value.para: A TickMark enumeration indicating whether the major tick marks are inside, outside, or cross the axis, or are nonexistent.

summary.para: Gets or sets the style of minor tick marks.

value.para: A TickMark enumeration indicating whether the minor tick marks are inside, outside, or cross the axis, or are nonexistent.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating how the major gridlines are displayed.

value.para: A GridLines object indicating how the major gridlines are displayed.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating how the minor gridlines are displayed.

value.para: A GridLines object indicating how the minor gridlines are displayed.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Axis.MajorInterval

summary.para: Gets or sets the unit of measurement for major gridlines and tickmarks.

member.remarks: If omitted, the axis is automatically divided.

value.para: A ExpressionInfo value indicating the unit of measurement for major gridlines and tickmarks.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Axis.MinorInterval

summary.para: Gets or sets the unit of measurement for minor gridlines and tickmarks.

member.remarks: If omitted, the axis is automatically divided.

value.para: A ExpressionInfo value indicating the unit of measurement for minor gridlines and tickmarks.

summary.para: Gets or sets a Boolean value indicating whether the axis is plotted in reverse or normally. If set to true, the axis direction is reversed.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the axis direction is plotted in reverse; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Axis.CrossAt

summary.para: Gets or sets the value at which to cross the other axis.

member.remarks: If this value is omitted, it uses the default value for the chart type.

value.para: A ExpressionInfo value indicating the value at which to cross the other axis.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether strip lines are drawn for every second grid line interval for the axis. If grid lines are not used for the axis then the axis' tick marks or labels are used to determine the interlaced strip lines interval.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that strip lines are drawn for every second grid line interval for the axis; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Axis.Scalar

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the values along the axis are scalar values (i.e. numeric or date) which are displayed on the chart in a continuous flow with missing numbers or dates filled in.

member.remarks: Scalar cannot be true if the axis has more than one grouping, if the grouping is static or has more than one group expression, or if the axis values have labels.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the values along the axis are scalar (i.e numeric or date) values; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Axis.Min

summary.para: Gets or sets the minimum value for the axis.

member.remarks: If omitted, the axis automatically scales.

value.para: A ExpressionInfo value indicating the minimum value for the axis.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Axis.Max

summary.para: Gets or sets the maximum value for the axis.

member.remarks: If omitted, the axis automatically scales.

value.para: A ExpressionInfo value indicating the maximum value for the axis.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the axis is logarithmic.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the axis is logarithmic; otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.summary: The end cap style to use for the axis.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.DataPoint
member.summary: The DataPoint element defines a set of data for a single point in the chart. There must be a corresponding DataPoint for each static category in a static series. A DataPoint may consist of a single value expression (for example in a bar or line chart) or multiple value expressions (for example in a stock or bubble chart).

value.para: A Style object containing the border and background style properties for the data point.

member.remarks: The default value is the name of the corresponding static series or category. If there is no static series or category, "Value."

summary.para: Gets or sets a value defining how or whether a data point appears in a data rendering.

remarks.para: Output(Default) indicates that the DataPoints appear in the output.
NoOutput indicates that the DataPoints do not appear in the output.
See for other enumerated values.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.CustomData
member.summary: Defines the data to be handed to an interface.
member.remarks: This class represents the RDL CustomData element. A custom report item that defines a CustomData element is treated as a data region. This imposes the same restrictions on the custom report item as are imposed on other data regions (i.e. not allowed in detail rows, not allowed in page header/footer sections).

remarks.para: If Auto is specified, the application attempts to derive the case sensitivity setting by querying the data provider.

summary.para: Gets or sets the number of seconds to allow the query to run before timing out.

value.para: An Int32 indicating the number of seconds to allow the query to run before timing out.

remarks.para: The Timeout value must be nonnegative.
If the value for the Timeout property is omitted or is zero, the query does not time out.
The maximum value is 2147483647 seconds.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Field
member.summary: Defines a field element containing information about a field within the data model of the report.

remarks.para: A Field must have either a DataField or Value property set, but not both.

member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the field in the query.

value.para: A String containing the name of the field in the query.

remarks.para: Data field names do not need to be unique. Multiple fields can refer to the same data field.

summary.para: Gets or sets an expression that evaluates to the value of the field.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object containing the expression that evaluates to the value of the field.

remarks.para: For example: =Fields!Quantity.Value+Fields!UnitPrice.Value
The expression cannot contain aggregates or references to report items.
Expressions are fully described in the Expressions namespace.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name to use for the field within the report.

value.para: A String containing the name to use for the field within a report.

remarks.para: Field names need only be unique within the containing Fields collection.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Filter
member.summary: Defines a Filter element which describes a filter to apply to rows of data in a dataset or data region, or to apply to the group instances.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Filter.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets an expression that is evaluated for each instance within the group or each row of the dataset or data region and compared (via the Operator) to the .

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that is evaluated for each instance within the group or each row of the dataset or data region and compared (via the Operator) to the FilterValues.

remarks.para: Failed comparisons result in the row or instance being filtered out of the dataset, data region or grouping.

summary.para: Gets or sets the operator used when comparing the to the .

value.para: A FilterOperator enumeration of the operator used when comparing the FilterExpression to the FilterValues.

remarks.para: Top and Bottom operators include ties in the resulting data.
String comparisons are locale-dependent.
Null equals Null.

summary.para: Gets the values to compare to the FilterExpression.

value.para: An ExpressionInfoCollection object containing the values to compare to the FilterExpression

remarks.para: For Equal, Like, NotEqual, GreaterThan, GreaterThanOrEqual, LessThan, LessThanOrEqual, TopN, BottomN, TopPercent and BottomPercent, there must be exactly one FilterValue.
For TopN and BottomN, the FilterValue expression must evaluate to an integer.
For TopPercent and BottomPercent, the FilterValue expresson must evaluate to an integer or a float.

For TopN, BottomN, TopPercent and BottomPercent, the FilterValue expression is evaluated only once: for the first row (after all earlier filters have been applied) in the case of a dataset or data region; a filter for the first group instance (after all earlier filters have been applied) in the case of a group filter.
For Between, there must be exactly two FilterValues.
For In, the FilterValues are treated as a set (if the FilterExpression value appears anywhere in the set of FilterValues, the instance is not filtered out).
Like uses the same special characters as the Visual Basic LIKE operator (e.g. "?" to represent a single character and "*" to represent any series of characters).

summary.para: Defines a QueryParameter element which contains information about a parameter that is passed to the data source as part of the query.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.QueryParameter.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets an expression that evaluates to the parameter value to pass to the data source.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to the value to pass to the data source.

remarks.para: The expression can refer to report parameters but cannot contain references to report elements, fields in the data model, or aggregate functions.

In the case of a parameter for a Values or DataValues query, the expression can only refer to report parameters that occur earlier in the parameters list. The value for this query parameter is then taken from the user selection for that earlier report parameter.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name for the parameter.

value.para: A String containing the name for the parameter.

Oracle

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator
member.summary: Specifies the operator to use to compare the values returned by the FilterExpression with those in the FilterValues object.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.Equal
member.summary: Displays the record if the two values are equal.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.Like
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression results satisfy the pattern set in the FilterValues.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.NotEqual
member.summary: Displays the record if the two values are not equal.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.GreaterThan
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result is greater than the FilterValues.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.GreaterThanOrEqual
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result is greater than or equal to the FilterValues.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.LessThan
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result is less than the FilterValue.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.LessThanOrEqual
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result is less than or equal to the FilterValue.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.TopN
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result is in the top N of all records processed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.BottomN
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result is in the bottom N of all records processed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.TopPercent
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result is in the top N% of all records processed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.BottomPercent
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result is in the bottom N% of all records processed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.In
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result is within the list of FilterValues.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.FilterOperator.Between
member.summary: Displays the record if the FilterExpression result falls between the two FilterValues.

member.summary: The chart uses segments of a doughnut to display values to total 100%.

member.summary: The chart uses segments of a funnel to display values to total 100%.

member.summary: The chart uses segments of a pyramid to display values to total 100%.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Image.VerticalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the picture inside the image report item.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Image.HorizontalAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the picture inside the image report item.

summary.para: Gets or sets the source of the image.

value.para: An ImageSource enumeration indicating the source of the image.

remarks.para: If the source is set to External the Value property evaluates to the location of the image.
If the source is set to Embedded the Value property evaluates to the name of the EmbeddedImage in the report.
If the source is set to Database the Value property evaluates to the binary data of the image.

summary.para: Gets or sets the value of the image. See the Source property for more information.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object containing the value of the image. See the Source property for more information.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Image.MIMEType

summary.para: Gets or sets the MIME type of the image.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object containing the MIME type of the image.

member.remarks: Valid values are image/bmp, image/jpeg, image/gif, image/png, and image/x-png. This property is required if the source is set to Database, but ignored otherwise.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating the how the image is rendered if it does not fit within the defined size.

value.para: An ImageSizing enumeration indicating how the image is rendered if it does not fit within the defined size.

remarks.para: If Sizing is set to AutoSize, the control's borders grow or shrink to match the size of the image.
If Sizing is set to Fit, the image is resized to match the height and width of the control.
If Sizing is set to FitProportional, the image is resized while preserving the aspect ratio to match either the height or width of the control or both.
If Sizing is set to Clip, the image is clipped to fit inside the borders of the control.
Report output formats which do not support FitProportional or Clip substitute Fit.

The default value is "Item."

summary.para: Gets or sets an expression by which to sort the groups.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object by which to sort the groups.

References to report items are not allowed.

remarks.para: The default value is Ascending

member.summary: Specifies an element that defines the expressions by which to group the data.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Grouping.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets a label to identify an instance of the group within the client UI (to provide a user-friendly label for searching).

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object for a label to identify an instance of the group within the client UI.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grouping is in it's own section

value.para: A Boolean value indicating whether the grouping is in it's own section. Default value is false.

summary.para: Gets a set of expressions by which to group the data.

value.para: An ExpressionInfoCollection object by which to group the data.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the report breaks to a new page at the start of the group.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the report breaks to a new page at the start of the group; otherwise false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: This property is not valid for column groupings in the Matrix regions.
Grouping page breaks on table groups are ignored if the group has no header and no footer, no subgroups have a header or footer and there is no detail row in the table.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the report breaks to a new page at the end of the group.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the report breaks to a new page at the end of the group; otherwise false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: This property is not valid for column groupings in Matrix regions.
Grouping page breaks on table groups are ignored if the group has no header and no footer, no subgroups have a header or footer and there is no detail row in the table.

summary.para: Gets or sets information to be passed to the report output component.

value.para: A Custom object containing information to be passed to the report output component.

summary.para: Gets filters to apply to each instance of the group.

value.para: A FilterCollection object containing filters to apply to each instance of the group.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the grouping.

value.para: A String indicating the name of the grouping.

remarks.para: This property is used for RunningValue and RowNumber aggregate functions.
No two grouping elements may have the same name and no grouping element may have the same name as a dataset or a data region.

summary.para: Gets or sets an expression that identifies the parent group in a recursive hierarchy.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object indicating the parent group in a recursive hierarchy.

remarks.para: This property only applies if the group has exactly one group expression
Indicates the following:

item.description: Groups are sorted according to the recursive hierarchy (sort is still used to sort peer groups).
Labels (in the document map) are indented according to the recursive hierarchy.
Intra-group show/hide toggles items according to the recursive hierarchy (see ToggleItem).

remarks.para: If filters on the group eliminate the parent of a group instance, it is instead treated as a child of the parent's parent.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name for the data element for instances of this group.

value.para: A String indicating the name to use for the data element for instances of this group.

remarks.para: The default value is the name of the group.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name to use for the data element for the collection of all instances of this group.

value.para: A String indicating the name to use for the data element for the collection of all instances of this group.

remarks.para: The default value is "DataElementName_Collection."

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the group appears in a data rendering.

value.para: A DataElementOutput enumeration indicating whether the group appears in a data rendering.

remarks.para: This property is ignored if there is a grouping for the list.
Output (Default) indicates that the group appears in the output.
NoOutput indicates that the group does not appear in the output.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Subtotal
member.summary: The Subtotals element defines a subtotal column or row to include in the Matrix.

remarks.para: In the subtotal column or row, the full set of data for the entire group is aggregated in the matrix cell.

If a matrix cell contains an aggregate that uses an explicit grouping scope contained within the scope of the aggregate, that scope is automatically adjusted to equal the current scope. For example, if a textbox in a matrix cell contains the expression =Sum(Fields!Sales.Value/Sum(Fields!Sales.Value,"State") and this subtotal is applied to the Country grouping scope, the expression evaluates to =Sum(Fields!Sales.Value)/Sum(Fields!Sales.Value,"Country"), since the State grouping scope is contained within the country grouping scope.

value.para: A Style object containing the style properties that override any style properties of report items contained in the subtotal column or row.

remarks.para: At Subtotal Column and Row intersections, the Row style takes priority.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the subtotal column or row appears before (left or above) or after (right or below) the detail columns or rows.

value.para: A SubtotalPosition enumeration indicating whether the subtotal column or row appears before or after the detail columns or rows.

summary.para: The name to use for the subtotal.

remarks.para: The default value is "Total."

value.para: A String indicating the name to use for the subtotal element.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the subtotal appears in a data rendering.

value.para: A DataElementOutput enumeration indicating how or whether the subtotal appears in a data rendering.

remarks.para: Output indicates that the subtotal appears in the output.
NoOutput(Default) indicates that the subtotal does not appear in the output.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Visibility
member.summary: The Visibility element controls whether the ReportItem is initially shown in the output report.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the textbox used to hide or reveal the report item.

value.para: A String representing the name of the textbox used to hide or reveal the report item.

Remarks.para: Clicking an instance of the ToggleItem toggles the hidden state of every corresponding instance of the item. If the ToggleItem becomes hidden, this item becomes hidden. This cascading does not apply if the ToggleItem becomes hidden as a result of a containing table column or matrix cell becoming hidden.
The ToggleItem must be a textbox in the same grouping scope as this item or in any containing grouping scope.
If a value for the ToggleItem is omitted, no item toggles the hidden state of this item.
ToggleItems are not allowed on and cannot refer to report items contained in a page header or footer.
ToggleItems cannot refer to a report item contained within the current report item unless the current grouping scope has a Parent.

summary.para: Gets or sets a Boolean expression that indicates whether the item is initially hidden.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a Boolean value indicating whether the item is initially hidden. The default value is false.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the textbox used to hide or reveal the report item.

value.para: A String representing the name of the textbox used to hide or reveal the report item.

Remarks.para: Clicking an instance of the ToggleItem toggles the hidden state of every corresponding instance of the item. If the ToggleItem becomes hidden, this item becomes hidden. This cascading does not apply if the ToggleItem becomes hidden as a result of a containing table column or matrix cell becoming hidden.
The ToggleItem must be a textbox in the same grouping scope as this item or in any containing grouping scope.
If a value for the ToggleItem is omitted, no item toggles the hidden state of this item.
ToggleItems are not allowed on and cannot refer to report items contained in a page header or footer.
ToggleItems cannot refer to a report item contained within the current report item unless the current grouping scope has a Parent.

summary.para: Gets or sets an expression that evaluates to the ID of a bookmark within the report to which to navigate when the report item is clicked.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to the ID of a bookmark within the report to which to navigate when the report item is clicked.

remarks.para: If no bookmark with this ID is found, the link is not included in the report. If the bookmark is hidden, the link goes to the start of the page of the bookmark. If multiple bookmarks with the ID are found, the link goes to the first one.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ReportParameter
member.summary: The ReportParameter element contains information about a parameter for the report.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ReportParameter.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets the data type of the parameter.

value.para: A ReportParameterDataType enumeration representing the data type of the parameter.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the value for this parameter is allowed to be Null.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the parameter is allowed to be null; otherwise false. The default value is false.

summary.para: Gets or sets the default value to use for the parameter (if none is provided by the user).

value.para: A DefaultValue object used to supply the parameter.

remarks.para: If no value is provided as a part of the definition or by the user, the value is null. A DefaultValue is required if there is no Prompt and either Nullable is False or a ValidValues list is provided that does not contain Null (an omitted value).

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the value for this parameter is allowed to be an empty string.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the parameter is allowed to be an empty string; otherwise false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: This property is ignored if the DataType is not string.

summary.para: Gets or sets the user prompt to display when asking for parameter values.

value.para: A String representing the user prompt to display when asking for parameter values.

remarks.para: If this value is omitted, the user is not prompted for a value for the parameter.

summary.para: Gets or sets the possible values for the parameter (for an end-user prompting interface).

value.para: A ValidValues object containing the possible values for the parameter.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether mutltiple values for this parameter are allowed.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that mutliple parameter values are allowed; otherwise false. The default value is false.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parameter is used in a query in the report.

value.para: A ReportParameterUsedInQuery enumeration indicating whether the parameter is used in a query in the report.

remarks.para: This property is used to determine whether queries need to be re-executed if the parameter changes.
Auto (Default) indicates that the UsedInQuery setting is automatically detected. Auto returns true if the parameter is referenced in any query value expression, otherwise false.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the parameter (this is the name used when expressions refer to the parameter).

value.para: A String representing the name of the parameter.

remarks.para: Parameter names need only be unique within the containing Parameters collection.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this parameter should be visible to the end user.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates this parameter should not be visible to the end user.; otherwise false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: The paramer will still be usable programatically, such as with subreports and drillthrough reports, when the property is set to true.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the parameter supposes to get the multiline values.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the parameters supposes to get the multiline values otherwise false. The default value is false.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.DefaultValue
member.summary: The default value for the parameter.

remarks.para: DefaultValue must have one and only one of the following properties set: Values or DataSetReference.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.DefaultValue.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets the query to execute to obtain the default value(s) for the parameter.

value.para: A DataSetReference object representing the query to execute to obtain the default value(s) for the parameter.

remarks.para: If this property is not set, the first value of the ValueField is used.

summary.para: Gets the default values for the parameter.

value.para: An ExpressionInfoCollection object containing the default values for the parameter.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.DataSetReference
member.summary: The query to execute to obtain a list of values or default values for a parameter.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.DataSetReference.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the dataset to use in the parameter.

value.para: A String representing the name of the dataset to use.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the field to use for the values and defaults for the parameter.

value.para: A String representing the name of the field to use for the values and defaults for the parameter.

summary.para: Gets or sets name of the field to use for the value displayed to the user for the selection.

value.para: A String representing the name of the field to use for the value displayed to the user for the selection.

Remarks.para: If not supplied, or the returned value is null, the value in the ValueField is used.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidValues
member.summary: The possible values for the parameter. This is used to populate UI selection lists from which users can select a parameter value.

remarks.para: A ValidValues object must have one and only one of the following properties set: DataSetReference or ParameterValues.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidValues.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets the query to execute to obtain the default value(s) for the parameter.

value.para: A DataSetReference object representing the query to execute to obtain the default value(s) for the parameter.

remarks.para: By default, this is the first value from the property of the DataSetReference object.

summary.para: Gets a set of hardcoded values for the parameter.

value.para: A ParameterValuesCollection containing hardcoded values for the parameter.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ParameterValue
member.summary: A possible value for the parameter.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ParameterValue.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets a possible value for the parameter.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object representing a possible value for the parameter.

remarks.para: For Boolean parameters, use "true" or "false."
For DateTime parameters, use ISO 8601 date time format: yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss[.mmm]
For Float parameters, use "." as the optional decimal separator.

summary.para: Gets or sets the user-friendly label to display for the value in the UI.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object representing a label to display for the value in the UI.

remarks.para: If not supplied, the Value is used as the label. If a Value is not supplied, the Label is an empty string.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style
member.summary: The Style element contains information about the style of a report item. Where possible, the style property names and values match standard HTML/CSS properties. All expression-based Style elements evaluate to either the type listed or to Nothing (an error in evaluation is treated as Nothing). Nothing is equivalent to not specifying the style, thereby indicating that it uses the default value. The epxression must evaluate to a Boolean value for Boolean properties, an enumerated value for enum properties, an integer for integer properties and a (formatted) string for all other properties.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style.BackgroundColor

summary.para: Gets or sets the color of the background.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to the color of the background.

member.remarks: If a value for this property is omitted, the background is transparent.

summary.para: Gets or sets the gradient type of the background.

value.para: An enumerated ExpressionInfo that evaluates to the BackgroundGradientType of the background. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: The background is a solid color with no gradient.
The BackgroundColor begins on the left and blends into the BackgroundGradientEndColor on the right.
The BackgroundColor begins at the top and blends into the BackgroundGradientEndColor at the bottom.
The BackgroundColor begins at the center and blends into the BackgroundGradientEndColor at the edges.
The BackgroundColor begins at the bottom left and blends into the BackgroundGradientEndColor at the top right.
The BackgroundColor begins at the bottom right and blends into the BackgroundGradientEndColor at the top left.
The BackgroundColor begins in a vertical swatch at the center and blends into the BackgroundGradientEndColor on the left and right.
The BackgroundColor begins in a horizontal swatch at the center and blends into the BackgroundGradientEndColor at the top and bottom.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style.BackgroundGradientEndColor

summary.para: Gets or sets the end color for the background gradient.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo that evaluates to the end color for the background gradient.

member.remarks: If this value is omitted, there is no gradient.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style.BackgroundImage

summary.para: Gets the background image for the report item.

value.para: A BackgroundImage object containing the background image for the report item.

member.remarks: If omitted, there is no background image.

summary.para: Gets or sets the font style.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to an enumerated FontStyle. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: Prints text normally.
Prints text with the letters slanting to the right.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of the font family.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo that evaluates to a string containing the name of the font family.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style.FontSize

summary.para: Gets or sets the point size of the font.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo that evaluates to a containing the point size of the font.

member.remarks: The default value is 10pt. The minimum value is 1pt, and the maximum value is 200pt.

summary.para: Gets or sets the thickness of the font.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a FontWeight enumeration or a number between 100 and 900 indicating the thickness of the font. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: A light font weight with a numeric value of 300.
A normal font weight with a numeric value of 400.
A medium font weight with a numeric value of 500.
A semi-bold font weight with a numeric value of 600.
A bold font weight with a numeric value of 700.
An extra-bold font weight with a numeric value of 800.
The heaviest possible font weight with a numeric value of 900.
Selects the next value that is darker than the inherited value.

summary.para: Gets or sets a .NET Framework formatting string.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo that evaluates to a .NET Framework formatting string.

remarks.para: Locale-dependent currency formatting (format code "C") is based on the language setting of the report item.
Locale-dependent date formatting is supported and is based on the language property of the ReportItem.

summary.para: Gets or sets special text formatting.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a TextDecoration enumeration indicating the special text formatting. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: No special formatting is used.
Text is rendered with a line below it.
Text is rendered with a line above it.
Text is rendered with a line through it.

summary.para: Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the text.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a TextAlign enumeration indicating the horizontal alignment of the text. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: The alignment is based on the content type.
Text is aligned to the left.
Text is centered in the control.
Text is aligned to the right.

summary.para: Gets or sets the vertical alignment of the text.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a VerticalAlign enumeration indicating the vertical alignment of the text. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: Text is aligned to the top.
Text is centered in the control.
Text is aligned to the bottom.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style.Color

summary.para: Gets or sets the foreground or text color.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo that evaluates to the foreground color.

member.remarks: The default value is Black.

summary.para: Gets or sets the amount of padding between the left edge of the report item and its contents.

value.para: A Length ExpressionInfo that evaluates to the padding between the left edge of the report item and its contents.

remarks.para: The default value is 0pt. The maximum value is 1000pt.
As both borders and padding are measured from the edge of the object, borders may overlap the contents of report items unless there is sufficient padding.

summary.para: Gets or sets the amount of padding between the right edge of the report item and its contents.

value.para: A Length ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to the padding between the right edge of the report item and its contents.

remarks.para: The default value is 0pt. The maximum value is 1000pt.
As both borders and padding are measured from the edge of the object, borders may overlap the contents of report items unless there is sufficient padding.

summary.para: Gets or sets the amount of padding between the top edge of the report item and its contents.

value.para: A Length ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to the padding between the top edge of the report item and its contents.

remarks.para: The default value is 0pt. The maximum value is 1000pt.
As both borders and padding are measured from the edge of the object, borders may overlap the contents of report items unless there is sufficient padding.

summary.para: Gets or sets the amount of padding between the bottom edge of the report item and its contents.

value.para: A Length ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to the padding between the bottom edge of the report item and its contents.

remarks.para: The default value is 0pt. The maximum value is 1000pt.
As both borders and padding are measured from the edge of the object, borders may overlap the contents of report items unless there is sufficient padding.

summary.para: Gets or sets the height of a line of text.

value.para: A Length ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to the height of a line of text.

remarks.para: By default, the report output format determines the line height based on the font size.
The minimum value is 1pt; the maximum is 1000pt.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style.LineSpacing
member.summary: Space between lines

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style.CharacterSpacing
member.summary: Space between characters

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether text is written left-to-right or right-to-left.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a enumeration determining the direction in which text is written. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: Left to right.
Right to left.

remarks.para: This property does not impact the alignment of text unless General alignment is used.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Style.WrapMode
member.summary: Wrap mode

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether text is written horizontally or vertically.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a WritingMode enumeration determining whether text is written horizontally or vertically. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: Left to right, top to bottom.
Top to bottom, right to left.

summary.para: Gets or sets the primary language of the text.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a language value which complies with the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) RFC1766 specification.

summary.para: Gets or sets the level of embedding with respect to the Bi-directional algorithm.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a UnicodeBiDi enumeration indicating the level of embedding with respect to the Bi-directional algorithm. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: The report item does not open an additional level of embedding.
The report item opens an additional level of embedding.
The report item opens an additional level of embedding with sequential reordering.

summary.para: Gets or sets the type of calendar to use for formatting dates.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a Calendar enumeration indicating the type of calendar to use for formatting dates. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: The Gregorian calendar with localized strings.
The Gregorian calendar with Arabic strings.
The Gregorian calendar with Middle East French strings.
The Gregorian calendar with transliterated English strings.
The Gregorian calendar with transliterated French strings.
The Gregorian calendar with American English strings.
The Hebrew lunar calendar.
The Islamic lunar calendar.
The Japanese Emperial Era calendar.
The Korean Tangun Era calendar.
The Taiwanese Republican Era calendar.
The Thai Buddhist calendar (Gregorian months and days with Thai years and eras).

remarks.para: The calendar type must be compatibile with the Language setting in the .NET framework.

summary.para: Gets or sets the digit format to use as described by its primary language. Any language is legal.

value.para: A language ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a language value which complies with the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF) RFC1766 specification.

remarks.para: The Language property is used by default.

summary.para: Gets or sets the variant of the digit format to use.

value.para: An integer ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to the variant of the digit format to use.

remarks.para: Currently defined values are:

item.description: Default, follow Unicode context rules
Traditional digits for the script as defined in GDI+. Currently supports: ar|bn|bo|fa|gu|hi|kn|kok|lo|mr|ms|or|pa|sa|ta|te|th|ur and variants.
ko, ja, zh-CHS, zh-CHT only
ko, ja, zh-CHS, zh-CHT only
ko, ja, zh-CHS, zh-CHT only (Wide versions of regular digits)
ko only

member.summary: Defines a background image for the report.

member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.

member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets the source of the image.

value.para: An ImageSource enumeration representing the source of the image. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: The contains a constant or expression that evaluates to the location of the image.
The Value contains a constant or expression that evaluates to the name of an EmbeddedImage within the report.
The Value contains an expression (a field in the database) that evaluates to the binary data for the image.

summary.para: Gets or sets the value of the background image (see source).

value.para: A string ExpressionInfo that evaluates to the value of the background image.

summary.para: Gets or sets the MIMEType for the image.

value.para: A string ExpressionInfo that evaluates to a MIMEType for the image.

remarks.para: Valid values are: image/bmp, image/jpeg, image/gif, image/png, and image/x-png.
MIMEType is required if the Source is set to Database; otherwise it is ignored.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating how the background image repeats to fill the available space: vertically (RepeatY), horizontally (RepeatX), both (Repeat), or neither (NoRepeat).

value.para: An object that evaluates to a BackgroundRepeat enumeration. Valid values are listed in the table below.

item.description: The image repeats horizontally and vertically in the background.
The image is rendered once and does not repeat.
The image repeats horizontally in the background.
The image repeats vertically in the background.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Subreport
member.summary: Specifies a Subreport ReportItem, which is a separate report contained in the report definition.
member.remarks: If the report specified in the subreport does not execute properly, an error message is displayed in its place.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Subreport.GetExpressions
member.summary: Internal use only

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Subreport.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.Subreport.ReportName

summary.para: Gets or sets a string value containing the full path (e.g. "/salesreports/orderdetails") or relative path (e.g. "orderdetails") to the subreport.

value.para: A String containing the full or relative path to the subreport.

member.remarks: Relative paths are relative to the current application's folder. The value cannot be an empty string.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the transactions in the subreport are merged with the transactions in the parent report if the data sources use the same connection.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the subreport transactions merge with the parent report transactions if the data sources use the same connection; otherwise false. The default value is false.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the subreport uses the theme from the current report.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the subreport uses the theme from the current report; otherwise false. The default value is false.

summary.para: Gets or sets a message to display in the subreport instead of the region layout when no rows of data are available in any dataset for the subreport.

value.para: A String message to display in the subreport when no rows of data are available.

remarks.para: Style information for this text is taken from the subreport.
If the subreport is in a table or matrix cell and does not have a NoRows property, the contents of the subreport are omitted, but the subreport's border properties still apply to the cell.

summary.para: Gets the parameters for the subreport.

value.para: A ParameterCollection containing the parameters for the subreport.

remarks.para: If the subreport is executed without parameters and contains no Toggle elements, it is only executed once even if it appears inside of a list, table, or matrix..

summary.para: Gets or sets the number of columns the cell spans.

For the purpose of hidden columns, the cell is considered to occupy the first visible column in which it appears. Hiding a spanned column reduces the effective number of columns spanned. The cell remains visible, spanning the nonhidden columns, unless all spanned columns are hidden.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the textbox size can increase to accommodate the contents.

value.para: A Boolean value where true indicates that the size of the textbox can increase to accomodate the contents; otherwise false. The default value is false.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the textbox size can decrease to match the contents.

value.para: A Boolean where true indicates that the size of the textbox can decrease to match the contents; otherwise false. The default value is false.

summary.para: Gets or sets the name of a grouping or data set within which to hide the item when the value of the expression associated with the textbox is the same as the preceding instance.

value.para: A String containing the name of a grouping or data set within which the item is hidden when the value of the expression associated with the report item is the same as the preceding instance.

remarks.para: The value of HiddenDuplicates is the name of a grouping or data set over which to apply the hiding. Each time a new instance of that group is encountered, the first instance of this report item is not hidden. Rows on a previous page are ignored for the purposes of hiding duplicates. If the textbox is in a table or matrix cell, only the text is hidden. The textbox remains to provide background and border for the cell.
This property is ignored in matrix subtotals

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating the initial state of a toggling image, if one is displayed as part of the textbox. The toggle image displays as a plus sign (+) to indicate a collapsed state with hidden report items, and as a minus sign (-) to indicate an expanded state with all report items visible.

value.para: A ToggleImage object indicating the initial state of a toggling image, if one is displayed as part of the textbox.

remarks.para: The ToggleImage is used along with the Visibility class for report items toggled with a textbox.

summary.para: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the end-user sort control should be displayed as part of the textbox UI.

value.para: A UserSort value indicating whether the end-user sort control should be displayed as part of the textbox UI.

summary.para: Returns the number of degrees the text is rotated counter-clockwise. Negative values indicate a clockwise rotation.

value.para: A float value indicating the number of degrees the text is rotated counter-clockwise. Negative values indicate a clockwise rotation.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.TextBox.ShrinkToFit
member.summary: Select whether the Textbox shrinks text to fit fixed sized control.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ToggleImage
member.summary: Indicates the initial state of a toggle image if such an image is displayed as part of the Textbox.
member.remarks: The image is always displayed if the texbox is a toggle item for another report item. If no ToggleImage element is present, no image is displayed. The toggle image displays as a plus sign (+) to indicate a collapsed state with hidden report items, and as a minus sign (-) to indicate an expanded state with all report items visible. Whenever the textbox or image is clicked, the toggle image state flips and the image associated with the new state is displayed instead.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ToggleImage.Validate(GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.ValidationContext)
member.summary: Validates the information in each property of the object.
member.param: The object containing the contextual information used to drive the validation.
member.returns: A array containing all the validation entries found, or empty if none are found.

summary.para: Gets or sets a Boolean expression, the value of which determines the initial state of the toggle image.

value.para: An ExpressionInfo object that evaluates to a Boolean value which determines the initial state of the toggle image. The default value is false, or collapsed (+).

remarks.para: A value of true displays an expanded toggle image (a minus sign).
A value of false displays a collapsed toggle image (a plus sign).

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.UserSort.SortExpression
member.summary: Gets or sets the expression to sort on.
member.remarks: Has the same restrictions as a grouping filter expression. Aggregates used in the SortExpression should only use scopes equal, or contain, the SortExpressionScope. If no SortExpressionScope is specified aggregates must set the scope.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.UserSort.SortExpressionScope
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the data region, or grouping, scope to evaluate the expression in.

remarks.para: If omitted, the expression will be evaluated and the sort will be performed independently in each detail scope in the SortTarget.
The scope must be equal to, or contained, inside the current scope. If the has no current scope the value must be equal to or contained within the SortTarget.
The SortExpressionScope and the SortTarget must use the same data set.

Sorting takes place within the group containing the SortExpressionScope. For instance: In a table with a state group and a city group with UserSort on each header and SortExpressionScope on the corresponding group, the state sort will sort the state groups within the table and the city sort will sort the city groups within each state group without rearranging the country state groups.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.PageReportModel.UserSort.SortTarget
member.summary: Gets or sets name of the data region, grouping, or data set to apply the sort to.

remarks.para: If omitted, the sor twill apply to the current scope.
Must be the current scope, and ancestor scope, or a peer scope which is a data region.
Matrix groupings are only valid SortTargets from within matrix grouping scopes along the same matrix axis.
